title: New Comic - Ziggs and Jinx: Paint the Town

embed.description: Yordles live among us. Oh, they say I'm crazy -- they say that Yordles would be easy to spot in a city such as ours, what with their fuzzy countenances and diminutive stature. But I've heard rumors that they have invented some sort of magical charms that make these abominations appear no different from you or I.

body: A little look in to the lives of two exposion lovers!

replies.body:
I'm rather disappointed with this comic.

* Least important first, but I don't like the graphic style. That's subjective and personal, but that doesn't help...
* It's yet more teasing about the nature of Yordles without a clear explanation.
* It's just violence without consequence, and the characters don't really develop. There was almost a moment there with the donger "betrayal", but well, no, doesn't matter in the end.

It's a big let down compared to the Darius one, I think.

Regarding the development, I disagree. They set up how Heimer's and Ziggs' can live in Piltover and their relationship, they had three champions interact for the first time, they moved Ziggs' arc forward by breaking him up with Heimer and moved Ziggs' and Jinx's arcs forward by making them a duo. Then they also revealed a bunch of visual development and a few story hooks to boot!

I totally agree with this. We just got a huge look into Jinx, Ziggs and Heimerdinger (mostly Jinx and Ziggs) as characters while also learning a little more about how Yordles work. Different characters have different ways of developing, cause pyromaniacs/psychopaths aren't going to have the same kind of moments as normal people.

Also, I like that Jinx isn't working alone now, cause it will provide for some interesting story telling of her and Ziggs butting heads when it comes to more extreme acts of terrorism. I can also see this duo breaking up at some point, when Jinx gets bored of Ziggs' morals.

Another interesting thing, is that Jinx could see past the Glamour. I think this supports my theory that she was a victim of Singed's experiments at some point after Warwick got away. There seems to be a bit more going on with Jinx than guns and explosives.

Nah. I believe Yordles' glamours are based on how the person perceives the ideals that the yordle has/represents. Ex. that arrogant Noxian lord in Kled's story doesn't believe in Kled's ideals of insane courage and pure strength, so he saw Kled as an old man. Similarly with Tristana. The Demacians saw Poppy as a great hero, proving that their ideals are the same; they align. Jinx could see Ziggs in his true form because they embody the same ideal; blow up stuff.
You'd think a Yordle would know  this though, and Ziggs appeared to be pretty confused when Jinx could see him for what he is.
We know that Ziggs doesn't know this, and such a phenomenon is probably rare.

We learned that Heimer is responsible for the Yordle charms, which makes me wonder how Kled got one, or is the charm innate to them as well.

We know that Ziggs isn't a killer, and that somehow Jinx hasn't killed either yet.

We get some context on Ziggs' relationship with Heimer.

I believe the charm is somewhat innate, but probably they Yordles have some control over what they look like.  In Ziggs' case, he doesn't really want to be in disguise, so he probably isn't putting much effort into it until the wardens try to arrest him.  Kled seems to have been able to extend his to Skarl in his story, which implies that Heimer could have extended his to Ziggs at the start of this comic just to ensure the customer doesn't break through it.

The way Riot's described it in the past is that everyone sees Yordles a bit differently.  They've hinted that it's based on how much the individual's ideals and the Yordle's ideals align.

Maybe there's some rule where like, technology interferes with magic?  At least, with natural Yordle magic.  Nothing Riot has said supports this, but it is a common trope.  Maybe we'll find out when Corki or Rumble's lore gets updated.

I don't think that's likely (been done too much sorta a thing) but it does make me wonder how Rumble and Corkie will be displayed if seen by human eyes.  Rumble is pretty much off in Bandle City most of the time so I don't think he's going to be seen often, but Corkie was part of the Piltover Expeditionary Force in the old lore, so he might be out in the world in the new lore.

In all likelyhood, the ROFL-copter would be affected by his magic as well, in a similar manner to Skaarl.  What that's going to end up meaning is going to be interesting.

If he did, it would be pretty strange. Before, it was implied that their appearance to most/all humans was because of their innate magical powers. However, in Tristanna's and Kled's color stories, they both appear to humans as crazy old people without any of this "glamor" (for those who argue that they did have them, I highly doubt Kled of all yordles would care about whether or not trespassers knew he was a yordle, as he would just kill them). I personally believe that some Demacians can see Poppy as a yordle because 

* 1) no one questions how an old lady is swinging a giant hammer, and 

* 2) no one asks why this old lady has been around for hundreds of years, 

Now I know these were made before the yordles had their magic appearance retcon their stories. Even so, there are only a couple ways Poppy's lore makes sense.

1. Poppy was much younger looking (teens to 30s maybe) when she approached Orlon, which is why he allows her to join the group and bestows upon her the quest of giving the hammer to the hero. And apparently Demacians are cool with an old lady carrying a massive hammer for hundreds of years and not questioning it.

2. Everyone could see her as a yordle because Demacia and reasons, which would mean that despite hating magic, the people are cool with magical creatures.

3. Only a select few can see Poppy as a yordle, such as Orlon ("for the first time ever, she would reveal herself to a human"), the little girl who compares her to the statue ("Look, Da. It's the slayer! The one from the statue!" PS, this is a really weird line, as the statue looks nothing like Poppy, but this girl somehow thinks Poppy looks like a 7-foot jacked-up dude, but whatever), and Galio. This would make sense as it is never stated than **no** human can see a yordle, otherwise there wouldn't be a term for their race. However this still suffers from the whole "chill with cool grandma" part.

Anyways, the Donger probably didn't make a special "glamor" thing for Poppy (it probably wouldn't work anyway, as Ziggs barely caught fire and got revealed, and I'm pretty sure Poppy has been in more scrapes than Ziggs ever has), and Poppy's lore is in need of clarification.
